children.subject: you can just follow by hovering on top right of post under actions and click follow.
Posting to follow since I would like to know more about these two classes as well

history.content:
I don't know all the answers, but I'll start it off and others can add on by editing the answer.

1. 161 has partners for projects. I'm pretty sure 168 also has partners, although I haven't taken that class.

2. I would say you should phase 1 both. 168 is only offered in the fall, so it tends to be popular because everyone who wants to take it needs to sign up in the fall. 161 depends on who is teaching it, but I'd say either way it's probably a good idea to phase 1.

3. Don't know anything about math classes or 168. Hopefully others can chime in here. 161 has 3 projects and 3-4 homeworks. It's not a super high workload class. 

4. 161 is interesting if you're interested in cryptography and things like web security. You don't go super in depth into a particular topic, but it's a good overview of good security practices. Usefulness depends on what you want to do, more background would be helpful. Similarly for 168, interesting and usefulness will depend on your interests/goals.

5. Haven't taken 168, hopefully others can chime in. 

-Edit, Michael here

I am/have been a TA for both courses.

1. Both courses have allowed partners on projects in semesters I taught them, but not required them (although they are recommended).

2. Depends on your phase 2 time. The lectures in the past two semesters have both been fairly big, so people with early phase 2 times have been able to get in.

3. This changes from person to person, 4 technical courses is always on the heavier side.

4. They are both courses that give students an overview of the area, but are definitely useful if you want to dive deeper into systems.

5. 162 is not needed, but might provide some extra background (the last chunk of 162 covers some networking/security).

Several questions on these classes.

1. Do we have group projects (as opposed to individual) for these classes?

2. Should I phase 1 it? I want to make sure I get into those. Wondering if I can phase 2 and get in safely.

3. If I am taking 2 upper div. math classes on top of those, how does the workload sound?

4. Although this question might be abstract and pointless, how interesting AND useful are they? I've heard many instances where people dropped 168, and wanted more opinions on how the class goes and how useful it would be after I am done with it.

5. Posts below indicate that I do not need 162 for 168: would anybody think that I WOULD need 162?

Thanks!
history.subject: On 168 and 161
